flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=34>>34 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 34 years x 2 = <<34*2=68>>68 years old.
This means, Tully is 68 years - 3 years = <<68-3=65>>65 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 65 years - 1 year = 64 years old last year.
#### 64

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 34. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
